lead_paragraph: Justine Henin-Hardenne won her first WTA Championships title yesterday in Madrid, beating Amélie Mauresmo, 6-4, 6-3, a day after clinching the season-ending No. 1 ranking for the second time. Mauresmo double-faulted on match point — her fourth double fault of the day — to give Henin-Hardenne her sixth title of the year. Henin-Hardenne is the first player since Steffi Graf in 1993, and only the fifth ever, to reach all four Slam finals and the WTA Championships final in the same year.
